### Strategic decision making at the zoo

Senior management was considering purchasing a second site to overcome the physical constraints on their existing site. The Westmont Decision Lab worked with senior management across the organization to build a multi-attribute decision model.  The model considered a wide variety of strategic priorities for the Zoo, potential configurations of the new and existing site, and key risks.



### Designing a data collection and reporting tool to fight homelessness

The Westmont Decision lab created a mobile data collection weekly survey for a collaborative of organizations providing services to individuals experiencing homelessness.  The tool gathers data related to meals, medical services, case management services, hygiene services, clothing, animal welfare, and other services to communicate with government and the community.  The DLab also built a dashboard to summarize service metrics in real time.


### Implementing a data collection strategy for a non-profit empowering women in Uganda

The DLab worked with the executive direcor of a non-profit that supports women in Uganda through farming and child support programs.  The partner wanted a new data collection process to improve the reliability of their data and ease administrative burden
